arguments.description: Implement dark mode support across the mobile app, including UI theming, settings toggle, and system preference integration.
arguments.name: Dark Mode Feature

arguments.description: Implement dark mode theming across the app, including UI components, settings storage, and system preference integration.
arguments.success_criteria: 1) Dark mode toggle persists across sessions. 2) All UI components correctly adapt to dark theme colors. 3) System preference integration works on iOS and Android. 4) No visual regressions or crashes in dark mode. 5) Battery consumption is measurably reduced in dark mode usage.
arguments.name: Dark Mode Implementation
arguments.problem_statement: The mobile app currently lacks a dark mode option. Users have requested a system-wide dark theme that can be toggled manually and automatically adapts to system preferences, improving readability and battery efficiency.

details: Task timed out after 300s (4 turns completed)

arguments.content: We evaluated WebSockets vs long-polling for real-time notifications. WebSockets offer lower latency, reduced server load, and persistent connections, but introduce complexity in connection management and require robust handling of network failures and reconnections. Long-polling is simpler to implement and debug, works reliably over HTTP proxies, but incurs higher latency, increased server overhead due to repeated requests, and poorer scalability under high concurrency. Given our scalability goals and the need for near real-time user experiences, we chose WebSockets despite the added architectural complexity.
arguments.title: WebSockets vs Polling for Real-Time Notifications
